definition: field work/field personnel/any occupation that involves a great deal of field work

sentences.english: Field work is to be planned and implemented under the direct supervision of a QP .
sentences.chinese: 外勤工作是在資格人士監督之下直接策劃和實施的。

sentences.english: Field Ops provides more heavy fire power support.
sentences.chinese: 外勤兵提供重型火力支援。

sentences.english: Mason orders Tony to alert the field unit about what Jack revealed.
sentences.chinese: 梅森命令託尼將傑克透露的情報知會外勤部隊。

sentences.english: Yes, mostly office work and sometimes running errands.
sentences.chinese: 是的，大部分是辦公室工作，可有時跑外勤。

sentences.english: You're gonna be going out there on missions from now on.
sentences.chinese: 今後你都會去執行外勤任務了。

definition: special duty (e.g. extra security or traffic control on special occasions)/person on special duty
abbr. for 刑事警察[xing2 shi4 jing3 cha2]/criminal police
to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
SWAT (Special Weapons And Tactics)/riot police/abbr. for 特種警察|特种警察[te4 zhong3 jing3 cha2]
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
to track down/to investigate and arrest
